data_maturity_score.evidence: Mentions modern tools (AWS, Airflow, Dagster, Terraform), CI/CD, data quality testing, and governance policies, but no explicit data catalog or lineage tools mentioned

data_maturity_level.evidence: Matches score of 3 - documented processes, modern tools, some governance

maturity_signals.evidence: Explicitly mentions AWS, Airflow/Dagster, CI/CD pipelines, data quality validation, and data governance policies

scope_creep_score.evidence: Focused on data engineering responsibilities (pipelines, orchestration, storage) without conflating with data science, analytics, or DevOps roles

overtime_risk_score.evidence: Startup environment with 'lean & nimble' culture and 'agile' environment suggests potential for long hours, but hybrid model and no explicit on-call mentions are protective

role_clarity.evidence: Well-defined responsibilities focused on data pipelines, orchestration, storage, and infrastructure with clear qualifications

overall_red_flag_score.evidence: Low risk - well-defined DE role at funded startup with good engineering practices and reasonable work model

reporting_structure_clarity.evidence: Mentions 'Senior Data Engineer on our Core Engineering Data Team' but doesn't specify manager title

manager_level_inferred.evidence: Role is on 'Core Engineering Data Team' suggesting reporting to Engineering Manager rather than Director/CTO

team_growth_velocity.evidence: Mentions 'collaborative and agile environment where learning and growth are continuous' but no specific expansion numbers

team_composition.evidence: Only mentions 'Core Engineering Data Team' without specifying size or composition

reporting_structure.evidence: Implied by being part of 'Core Engineering Data Team' without higher-level reporting mentioned

cross_functional_embedded.evidence: Mentions collaborating with analysts, engineers, product managers, and stakeholders, suggesting embedded cross-functional work

work_life_balance_score.evidence: Hybrid work model (2 core days in office), no mention of on-call or overtime, but 'lean & nimble' startup culture suggests potential pressure

growth_opportunities_score.evidence: Mentions 'learning and growth are continuous' and 'collaborative environment' but no specific learning budget, conferences, or career paths mentioned

tech_culture_score.evidence: Strong modern stack (AWS, Airflow, Dagster, Terraform), CI/CD, testing emphasis, and infrastructure-as-code practices

tech_culture_signals.evidence: No mention of open source, tech blogs, conference speaking, hackathons, or innovation time

dev_practices_mentioned.evidence: Explicitly mentions CI/CD pipelines, monitoring performance/reliability of data pipelines, and designing solutions with stakeholders

innovation_signals.evidence: Mentions 'embracing new technologies' and 'agile environment' but no specific R&D time or experimentation culture mentioned

tech_debt_awareness.evidence: Mentions 'optimize table structures' and 'identify areas for improvement' suggesting awareness of technical debt

ai_integration_level.evidence: Mentions working with downstream ML applications but no specific ML infrastructure or MLOps tools mentioned

ml_tools_expected.evidence: No specific ML tools mentioned in job description, only 'downstream ML applications'

hiring_urgency.evidence: No explicit urgency signals like 'ASAP' or 'immediate start' mentioned

competition_level.evidence: Boston location (moderate competition), hybrid role, no salary disclosed in posting (though range provided), likely moderate competition

company_stage_inferred.evidence: Established company in home security industry with 'leading innovator' description, comprehensive benefits, and team building focus

hiring_velocity.evidence: Mentions 'building our team' and 'continuous learning and growth' suggesting regular hiring rather than aggressive expansion

team_size_signals.evidence: Mentions 'Core Engineering Data Team' suggesting multiple engineers, likely 6-15 based on company size and role scope

funding_stage_signals.evidence: Established company with comprehensive benefits package, equity offering, and focus on team building suggests Series B+ funding

role_creation_type.evidence: Mentions 'contribute to the formation of our new team' suggesting this is a new role being created for team expansion

strengths: Strong modern data stack (AWS, Airflow, Dagster, Terraform)
Comprehensive benefits package including equity and free security system
Hybrid work model with flexibility (2 core days in office)
concerns: Limited information on team size and growth trajectory
No specific learning budget or conference support mentioned
best_fit_for: Senior DEs with 4+ years experience in cloud data infrastructure
Engineers comfortable with hybrid work model and Boston location
Candidates seeking to build data platforms from the ground up
red_flags_to_probe: Ask about actual team size and composition
Understand the balance between new development vs. maintenance work
Clarify expectations for on-call or weekend support
negotiation_leverage: AWS expertise with specific services (Athena, CloudFormation) is valuable
Experience with data orchestration tools (Dagster/Airflow) is differentiator
Data governance and compliance experience is increasingly important
summary.overall_assessment: Solid opportunity for senior data engineers seeking to build data infrastructure at a growing security company. Strong technical stack and comprehensive benefits, with hybrid work flexibility. Main considerations are Boston location requirement and limited information on team growth and learning opportunities.
